description: Convenience scripts for integrated bootcamp runner with progress tracking

bootcamp:start.description: Start a lab step and optionally mark progress (add --mark-started <user> --cohort <id>)

bootcamp:finish.description: Complete a lab step and mark progress (add --mark-complete <user> --cohort <id> [--pr <num>])

rationale: These scripts provide semantic aliases that make the intent clearer. 'bootcamp:start' suggests beginning work on a lab, while 'bootcamp:finish' suggests completing it. Both use the same underlying 'step' command but with different expected flag combinations.
integrationNotes: The bootcamp:start and bootcamp:finish scripts are aliases for convenience
Cohort flag is mandatory when using mark flags
PR number is optional but recommended with --mark-complete
